results.title: The Gold rush
results.brief_description: A revival of the original silent Chaplin comedy with narrative and descriptive dialogue added about a lone prospector who ventures into Alaska for gold. He meets up with some unsavoury characters and falls in love with the beautiful Georgia. Cast includes Mack Swain, Georgia Hale, Tom Murray and Henry Bergman. The narrative was written and spoken by Charles Chaplin.

results.title: The Gold diggers
results.brief_description: A humorous dramatisation of the ballad about two diggers in search of gold. They are frustrated by bad weather, the lure of the ‘grog’, hard rock, costly water and finally…no gold! The words were written on the Victorian goldfields in the 1850s.

results.title: The Gods of Tiny Things
results.credit_line:
Deborah Kelly

Two-channel digital animation, colour, sound

ACMI Collection

results.brief_description: Deborah Kelly’s The Gods of Tiny Things is a vast, microscopic Eden teeming with deities born from the pages of old magazines and encyclopaedias, creating an exquisite collage of grotesque beauty and new mythologies.

constellations_primary.name: Speculative futures, sci-fi worlds and environmental disaster
constellations_primary.description: Deborah Kelly's The Gods of Tiny Things explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world through collage and imagined futures, much like these sci-fi, animated and computer-generated artworks.

results.description:
“This work is blessed by the powers of the animator, musicians and collagists. Having such creative collaborators is the treasure of my life” – Deborah Kelly

The Gods of Tiny Things is a vast, microscopic Eden teeming with deities born from the pages of old magazines and encyclopedias, creating an exquisite collage of grotesque beauty and new mythologies. Combining the divine, mundane and profane, these celestial creations animate a kaleidoscopic symbology that explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world, while simultaneously revelling in the persistence of pleasure, desire and life. Created at ‘collage camp’ at Bundanon on beautiful Yuin Country, this collaborative work is a poetic and urgent warning.

Deborah Kelly is a Sydney-based artist whose works have been shown around Australia, and in the Biennales of Singapore, Sydney, Thessaloniki, TarraWarra and Venice. Her projects across media are concerned with lineages of representation, politics and history in public exchange, and practices of collectivity on small and large scale, both fleeting and durational. Her newest works experiment with models of sustained creative collaboration between strangers. Kelly’s moving image artworks have been shown around the world, in galleries, cinemas and projected onto rock formations, buildings and clouds.

results.title: The Gods must be crazy
results.creator_credit: C A T Films and Jamie Uys
results.brief_description: Uys, a South African filmmaker, produced, directed and wrote this delightful, almost slapstick comedy about gentle Kalahari bushman Xi, who sets off on a trek to the ends of the earth to destroy a Coca Cola bottle which the “gods” had thrown from the sky. This ‘gift’ threatens to destroy the usual peace and happiness of the tribe. On his journey he unexpectedly collides with the modern world in the form of ruthless terrorists, a schoolteacher and a bumbling scientist studying elephant dung. ‘The Gods must be crazy’ is a comic fable which can be enjoyed by all ages.

results.title: The Godless state
results.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Christians”.
Traces the development of religious indifference and atheism from the French Revolution to the present. Focuses on the current state of religion in the Soviet Union, Poland, and Italy. However, makes the statement that with the New Testament there is no clear impression for readers about what Christianity stood for. The reader can glean from it any message that he/she wants…therefore Christianity has the ability to adapt.

results.title: The Godfather. Part III [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Al Pacino reprises his role as the powerful family patriarch, Michael Corleone. Now in his 60s, Michael is dominated by two passions: freeing his family from their connections with the Mafia and finding a suitable successor. That successor could be his hot-headed, violence-prone nephew, Vincent, played by Andy Garcia, but he may also be the spark that turns Michael’s hopes of business legitimacy into an inferno of mob violence. Stars Diane Keaton as Michael’s long-suffering wife and Sophia Coppola as his wilful daughter, Mary, who is involved in a fiery affair with Vincent. Eli Wallach is one of the old dons of the Corleone family and Joe Mantegna is Michael’s arch-enemy, Joey Zasa. This third film in the epic Corleone trilogy matches it’s predecessors in narrative intensity, socio-political analysis, physical beauty and depth of feeling for its characters. Original music by Carmine Coppola.
